kuusisto.tinysound

Interface Sound

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MemSound, StreamSound

    public interface Sound
    The Sound interface is an abstraction for sound effects. Sound objects should only be loaded via the TinySound loadSound() functions. Sounds can be played repeatedly in an overlapping fashion.
    Author:
    Finn Kuusisto

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void play()
      Plays this Sound.
      void play(double volume)
      Plays this Sound with a specified volume.
      void play(double volume, double pan)
      Plays this Sound with a specified volume and pan.
      void stop()
      Stops this Sound from playing.
      void unload()
      Unloads this Sound from the system.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        void play()
        Plays this Sound.

      • play

        void play(double volume)
        Plays this Sound with a specified volume.
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume at which to play this Sound

      • play

        void play(double volume,
        double pan)
        Plays this Sound with a specified volume and pan.
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume at which to play this Sound
        pan - the pan value to play this Sound [-1.0,1.0], values outside the valid range will assume no panning (0.0)

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops this Sound from playing. Note that if this Sound was played repeatedly in an overlapping fashion, all instances of this Sound still playing will be stopped.

      • unload

        void unload()
        Unloads this Sound from the system. Attempts to use this Sound after unloading will result in error.
